I sort of like it - maybe as option turned off by default? (could reconsider)

Sort of bike-shed issue, but would have to figure out exactly how the types are shown.  I like the 3-4 char abbreviations R uses as it keeps the repr compact, in pandas would have to contemplate things like 8 / 32 / 64 bit integers., categorical, etc.

```python
df = pd.DataFrame({'a': [1,2,3], 
                   'b': [1.1, 2.2, 3.3],
                   'c': pd.to_datetime(['2014-12-11', '2014-12-11', '2014-12-11']),
                    'd': pd.Categorical(['j', 'k', 'l']),
                   'e': ['m', 'n', 'p']})

df.dtypes
Out[39]: 
a             int64
b           float64
c    datetime64[ns]
d          category
e            object
```
